items.sentence: Tom told me he thought that Mary had studied French with John.
Tom told me that he thought that Mary was hesitant to do that.
Tom didn't deny that he was the one who stole Mary's necklace.
Tom knew there was a possibility that Mary would show up late.
Tom knew that there was a possibility that Mary would do that.
Tom knew that there was a possibility Mary would show up late.
I hope Tom sticks around for a while. I'd like to talk to him.
I think there's still a chance that Tom will get here on time.
I don't think Tom knows what time the party is going to start.
I don't think Tom knows how much coffee Mary drinks every day.
I don't think Tom has enough money to buy everything he needs.
I don't think you need to tell Tom what you're planning to do.
I don't think that Tom will be in his office tomorrow morning.
I don't think that it's going to be difficult to convince Tom.
I don't think Tom likes living in Boston as much as Mary does.
I don't think Tom knows what Mary is supposed to be doing now.
I don't think Tom knows what Mary and John are fighting about.
I don't think Tom knows what I want him to do for me tomorrow.
I don't think Tom knows how long he'll have to stay in Boston.
I don't think that I should need to tell Tom to do that again.
